alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 27 at 3:25AM CST until February 27 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Freezing Rain This Morning... .A potent, quick moving storm system will bring freezing rain to parts of the region this morning, generally around and north of the Interstate 94 corridor. The freezing rain transitions to snow in the afternoon, with most of those impacts holding north of Highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin. The freezing rain will reach the I-94 corridor by 5 am, continuing to spread northward and nearing Highway 10 in north-central Wisconsin by 7 am. Untreated surfaces, including roads and sidewalks, will quickly accrue ice. The freezing rain will generally persist for about 2 to 3 hours near I-94 before warmer temperatures start to move in. North of there, freezing rain could persist through most of the morning. There will be a change over to snow for the afternoon north of highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin, with 1 to 2 inch accumulations. Temperatures will play a key role in icing amounts. Small changes could result in substantial shifts in impacts. Pay close attention to the forecast for any revisions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Freezing rain this morning, transitioning to snow in the afternoon. Ice accumulations from 2 to 4 tenths of an inch. Snow accumulations of 1 to 2". Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
